question: Biodiversity does NOT usually show any latitudinal and altitudinal gradient in ........ [2022]
question_latex: Biodiversity does NOT usually show any latitudinal and altitudinal gradient in ........ [2022]
options: D. lower altitudes from mean sea level (MSL)
solution: Biodiversity distribution is relatively uniform in aquatic habitats compared to terrestrial ecosystems where distinct latitudinal and altitudinal gradients are observed.

question: Montreal protocol, which calls for appropriate action to protect the ozone layer from human activities was passed in the year
question_latex: Montreal protocol, which calls for appropriate action to protect the ozone layer from human activities was passed in the year
solution: In 1987, twenty-seven industrialized countries signed the Montreal protocol for the reduction and release of CFCs (chlorofluorocarbons) that deplete the ozone layer into the atmosphere.

question: The post Bhopal gas disaster analysis showed that the accident started, when the leakage of a tank started containing
question_latex: The post Bhopal gas disaster analysis showed that the accident started, when the leakage of a tank started containing
solution: The Bhopal gas tragedy was caused by the leakage of methyl isocyanate (MIC) when water entered a storage tank, causing an exothermic reaction and pressure increase.

question: Species richness is maximum [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Species richness is maximum [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Natural undisturbed tropical rain forests have the highest species richness due to stable climatic conditions and high productivity.

question: Which of the following is exotic species?
question_latex: Which of the following is exotic species?
solution: Parthenium, Lantana, and Eichhornia are all exotic (non-native) invasive species that have caused significant damage to Indian ecosystems.

question: One of endangered species of Indian medicinal plants is that of
question_latex: One of endangered species of Indian medicinal plants is that of
solution: Podophyllum is an Indian endangered medicinal plant; its rhizomes are used for treating chronic constipation and certain cancerous growths.

question: Which one of the following is INCORRECT? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which one of the following is INCORRECT? [MHT-CET 2024]
options: A. In 2018 Bharat Stage was implemented in Delhi.
B. Delhi leads the country in its level of air pollution.
C. All the city buses in Delhi run on CNG.
D. PIL was filled in Supreme Court against the air pollution in Delhi.
answer: A. In 2018 Bharat Stage was implemented in Delhi.
solution: The government actually implemented BS VI in 2018, skipping BS V entirely to accelerate the reduction of $CO_{2}$ and $SO_{2}$ levels.

question: Which of the following is absent in polluted water?
question_latex: Which of the following is absent in polluted water?
solution: Stone fly larvae are highly sensitive to low dissolved oxygen levels and chemical pollutants; therefore, they serve as bioindicators of clean water.

question: This pollutant causes burning sensation of throat and eyes and vomiting sensation.
question_latex: This pollutant causes burning sensation of throat and eyes and vomiting sensation.
solution: Hydrogen sulphide ($H_{2}S$), released from refineries and chemical industries, has a rotten egg smell and causes nausea and irritation in the eyes and throat.

question: Government of Maharashtra has taken up a project in 2016 of planting 50 cores trees as a part of National forest policy which aims at maintaining % of forest cover in the country. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Government of Maharashtra has taken up a project in 2016 of planting $50$ cores trees as a part of National forest policy which aims at maintaining \% of forest cover in the country. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: The National Forest Policy (NFP) aims to maintain $33\%$ forest cover in India to ensure ecological stability.

question: To reduce the level of air pollution, which device is used in thermal power plant? [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: To reduce the level of air pollution, which device is used in thermal power plant? [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Electrostatic precipitators are used in thermal power plants to remove $99\%$ of particulate matter from the exhaust gases.

question: Gir sanctuary is mainly for
question_latex: Gir sanctuary is mainly for
solution: The Gir National Park and Wildlife Sanctuary in Gujarat is the only natural habitat of the Asiatic Lion ($Panthera$ $leo$ $persica$).

question: Chipko movement was launched for the protection of
question_latex: Chipko movement was launched for the protection of
solution: The Chipko movement was a forest conservation movement in India where people hugged trees to prevent them from being cut down by contractors.

question: Based on the given chart of known species of organisms, choose the correct statement. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Based on the given chart of known species of organisms, choose the correct statement. [MHT-CET 2023]
options: A. Fungi are more than plants and eubacteria.
B. Animals are more in number than protists, fungi and plants.
C. Share of protists is least in known species of organisms.
D. Plants are less than fungi and eubacteria.
answer: B. Animals are more in number than protists, fungi and plants.
solution: Global species richness data shows that animals (especially insects) comprise more than $70\%$ of all known species, far exceeding plants and other kingdoms.

question: Which of the following is not a device used to control a particulate matter?
question_latex: Which of the following is not a device used to control a particulate matter?
solution: Incinerators are used for the thermal destruction of waste materials; scrubbers, filters, and arresters are used for particulate matter control.

question:
Match Column I with Column II and choose the correct option. [2022]
(A) Pawra tribals in Satpuda - (III) Conservation of varieties of corn
(B) Kanha forest - (II) Tiger reserve
(C) Ex-situ Conservation - (IV) Crocodile bank in Chennai
(D) Sacred groves - (I) Khasi and Jaintia hills in Meghalaya
question_latex: Match Column I with Column II and choose the correct option. [2022] \  egin{itemize} \item (A) Pawra tribals in Satpuda - (III) Conservation of varieties of corn \item (B) Kanha forest - (II) Tiger reserve \item (C) Ex-situ Conservation - (IV) Crocodile bank in Chennai \item (D) Sacred groves - (I) Khasi and Jaintia hills in Meghalaya \end{itemize}
options: A. A - II, B-III, C-I, D.IV
B. A - III, B - II, C.IV, D - I
C. A- III, B - II, C-I, D.IV
D. A - II, B-I, C - III, D - IV
answer: B. A - III, B - II, C.IV, D - I
solution: Correct matching: Pawra tribals conserve corn varieties; Kanha is a Tiger reserve; Crocodile bank is ex-situ; Khasi hills are sacred groves.

question: Reduction of Biological Oxygen Demand of effluents suggests
question_latex: Reduction of Biological Oxygen Demand of effluents suggests
solution: Biological Oxygen Demand (BOD) measures organic pollution; a reduction in BOD indicates that the water has been successfully treated and is relatively devoid of organic pollutants.

question: Which one of the following pairs is mismatched?
question_latex: Which one of the following pairs is mismatched?
options: B. Fossil fuel burning --- Release of $CO_{2}$
D. Solar energy --- Green house effect
answer: D. Solar energy --- Green house effect
solution: Solar energy is a clean, renewable resource that does not contribute to the greenhouse effect; $CO_{2}$ is the primary greenhouse gas.

question: Which of the following pairs represents endangered organisms in India?
question_latex: Which of the following pairs represents endangered organisms in India?
options: A. Bentinckia nicobarica and red panda
answer: A. Bentinckia nicobarica and red panda
solution: Bentinckia nicobarica (a rare palm) and the red panda are both officially listed as endangered species in India.

question: Hot spots are [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Hot spots are [MHT-CET 2024]
options: A. Regions with high species richness and density
B. Specific regions cultivating mecicinal plants
C. Regions protected in the name of Almighty
D. Regions which allow breeding in captivity
answer: A. Regions with high species richness and density
solution: Biodiversity hotspots are regions characterized by exceptionally high levels of species richness and significant endemism that are under threat.

question: Deforestation causes [MHT CET 2003]
question_latex: Deforestation causes [MHT CET 2003]
solution: Deforestation leads to the removal of vegetation cover, which exposes the topsoil to rain and wind, resulting in accelerated soil erosion.

question: The main cause of pollution in metrocities is
question_latex: The main cause of pollution in metrocities is
solution: In major cities, the heavy reliance on vehicles and industrial activity leads to the burning of fossil fuels, releasing $CO_{2}$, $SO_{2}$, and particulate matter.

question: Increase the atmospheric temperature due to $CO_{2}$ is called
question_latex: Increase the atmospheric temperature due to $CO_{2}$ is called
solution: The greenhouse effect is the trapping of heat in the atmosphere by gases like $CO_{2}$, leading to a global increase in temperature.

question: Which one of the following shows maximum genetic diversity in India?
question_latex: Which one of the following shows maximum genetic diversity in India?
solution: India has an estimated $200,000$ varieties of rice, demonstrating incredible genetic diversity at the species level.

question: A disease caused by eating fish contaminated by industrial waste containing mercury compounds is known as
question_latex: A disease caused by eating fish contaminated by industrial waste containing mercury compounds is known as
solution: Minamata disease is a neurological syndrome caused by severe mercury poisoning, famously occurring in Japan due to contaminated seafood.

question: Paul Ehrlich by Rivet Popper hypothesis has explained [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Paul Ehrlich by Rivet Popper hypothesis has explained [MHT-CET 2023]
options: A. The effect of human activities on biodiversity.
B. That rich biodiversity leads to lesser variation in biomass production.
C. The loss of key species affects balance of ecosystem.
D. The importance of species richness and high productivity.
answer: C. The loss of key species affects balance of ecosystem.
solution: The Rivet Popper hypothesis likens an ecosystem to an airplane and species to rivets; losing 'key' species can lead to catastrophic failure of the system.

question: Core zone, buffer zone and manipulation zone are found in
question_latex: Core zone, buffer zone and manipulation zone are found in
solution: Biosphere reserves are organized into three zones: a protected Core, a managed Buffer, and a Transition (Manipulation) zone for human activity.

question: Following are the biodiversity hot spots of India EXCEPT [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Following are the biodiversity hot spots of India EXCEPT [MHT-CET 2023]
options: D. Aravali hills of Rajasthan and Bastar
answer: D. Aravali hills of Rajasthan and Bastar
solution: The Indo-Burma, Western Ghats, and Eastern Himalayas are designated hotspots; Aravali and Bastar regions contain sacred groves.

question: In 2002 AD, according to research, the concentration of CFCs reached to
question_latex: In $2002$ AD, according to research, the concentration of $CFC_{s}$ reached to
solution: Atmospheric measurements in the early 2000s recorded CFC-11/12 concentrations in parts per trillion ($ppt$).

question: Edward Wilson, a sociologist, popularised the term.........[2022]
question_latex: Edward Wilson, a sociologist, popularised the term.........[2022]
solution: The term 'Biodiversity' was popularized by the sociobiologist Edward Wilson to describe the variety of life at all levels of biological organization.

question: One of the following is NOT a possible reason for use of CNG in automobiles, [MHT-CET 2014]
question_latex: One of the following is NOT a possible reason for use of CNG in automobiles, [MHT-CET 2014]
options: B. It is cheaper than petrol
solution: CNG is used because it is cheaper, cleaner, and cannot be easily adulterated like liquid fuels.

question: 5th June is celebrated as
question_latex: $5^{th}$ June is celebrated as
solution: World Environment Day has been celebrated annually on June $5$ since 1974 to raise global awareness for environmental protection.

question: Excess atmospheric CO2 increase green house effect as
question_latex: Excess atmospheric $CO_{2}$ increase green house effect as
options: A. Precipitates dust in the atmosphere
C. Is opaque to infra red rays
D. Is not opaque to infra red rays
answer: C. Is opaque to infra red rays
solution: $CO_{2}$ allows short-wave solar radiation to pass through but is opaque to long-wave infrared (heat) radiation reflected from Earth.

question: Rajaji national park is situated in
question_latex: Rajaji national park is situated in
solution: Rajaji National Park is an Indian national park and tiger reserve that encompasses the Shivaliks, near the foothills of the Himalayas in Uttarakhand.

question: A historic convention on biological diversity held in Rio de Janerio in 1992 is known as
question_latex: A historic convention on biological diversity held in Rio de Janerio in $1992$ is known as
solution: The United Nations Conference on Environment and Development (UNCED), also known as the Earth Summit, was held in Rio in 1992.

question: Land mass occupied by forest is [MHT CET 2009]
question_latex: Land mass occupied by forest is [MHT CET 2009]
solution: At the beginning of the $20^{th}$ century, forest cover in India was $30\%$; by the end of the century, it dropped to approximately $19.4\% - 22\%$.

question: The first biosphere reserve established in India for conserving the gene pool of flora and fauna and the life style of tribals is
question_latex: The first biosphere reserve established in India for conserving the gene pool of flora and fauna and the life style of tribals is
solution: Established in 1986, the Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve was India's first biosphere reserve, spanning parts of Tamil Nadu, Kerala, and Karnataka.

question: The part of earth in which life exists, is known as
question_latex: The part of earth in which life exists, is known as
solution: The Biosphere is the worldwide sum of all ecosystems; it is the zone of life on Earth.

question: Which one of the following is NOT a modern technique of ex-situ conservation of endangered species?[MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which one of the following is NOT a modern technique of ex-situ conservation of endangered species?[MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Seed banks are a traditional form of ex-situ conservation; techniques like cryopreservation and in-vitro fertilization are considered 'modern' biological approaches.

question: The wildlife Protection Act was introduced in
question_latex: The wildlife Protection Act was introduced in
solution: The Wildlife (Protection) Act, 1972 is an Act of the Parliament of India enacted for the protection of plants and animal species.

question: The soil pollutants that affect the food chain and food web by killing microorganisms and plants are
question_latex: The soil pollutants that affect the food chain and food web by killing microorganisms and plants are
solution: Pesticides used in agriculture persist in the soil and can enter the food chain, often killing non-target beneficial microorganisms.

question: Excessive accumulation of organic matter in water bodies leads to
question_latex: Excessive accumulation of organic matter in water bodies leads to
options: D. No effect on species diversity
solution: Eutrophication (organic overload) leads to oxygen depletion, which kills off sensitive aquatic species, thereby decreasing overall diversity.

question: CFC's methane, nitrogen oxide and carbon dioxide can absorb radiations reflected from the earth's surface. [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: CFC's methane, nitrogen oxide and carbon dioxide can absorb radiations reflected from the earth's surface. [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: Greenhouse gases like $CO_{2}$ and methane absorb infrared radiation reflected from Earth, trapping heat in the lower atmosphere.

question: Steps taken by the Government of India to control air pollution include
question_latex: Steps taken by the Government of India to control air pollution include
options: A. Compulsory mixing of 20% ethyl alcohol with petrol
C. Using fuel with 500 ppm sulphur
D. Use of non-polluting CNG as fuel for public transport
answer: D. Use of non-polluting CNG as fuel for public transport
solution: Following a PIL in the Supreme Court, the government mandated that the entire fleet of public transport in Delhi switch to CNG.

question: How many of the following are the manmade reasons to cause loss of biodiversity → Forest fire, habitat destruction, hunting, settlement, volcanic eruption overexploitation, earthquakes, reclamation. [2022]
question_latex: How many of the following are the manmade reasons to cause loss of biodiversity $ightarrow$ Forest fire, habitat destruction, hunting, settlement, volcanic eruption overexploitation, earthquakes, reclamation. [2022]
solution: Man-made reasons include habitat destruction, hunting, settlement, overexploitation, and reclamation. Volcanic eruptions and earthquakes are natural.

question: The beauty of Taj Mahal is endangered due to
question_latex: The beauty of Taj Mahal is endangered due to
options: A. Degradation of marble due to high temperature
B. Discharge of industrial waste in Yamuna river
C. Air pollutants released from oil refinery
answer: C. Air pollutants released from oil refinery
solution: The Mathura oil refinery releases $SO_{2}$ and $NO_{x}$, which react with moisture to form acid rain ($H_{2}SO_{4}$ and $HNO_{3}$), corroding the marble.

question: A lake with an inflow of domestic sewage rich in organic waste may result in
question_latex: A lake with an inflow of domestic sewage rich in organic waste may result in
options: A. Drying of the lake very soon due to algal bloom
B. An increased production of fish due to lot of nutrients
C. Death of fish due to lack of oxygen
D. Increased population of aquatic food web organisms
answer: C. Death of fish due to lack of oxygen
solution: Nutrient enrichment leads to algal blooms which deplete dissolved oxygen, causing mass mortality of fish and other aquatic life.

question: One of the following acts as secondary pollutant
question_latex: One of the following acts as secondary pollutant
solution: $HNO_{3}$ is a secondary pollutant formed when primary pollutants like $NO_{2}$ interact with atmospheric water vapor.

question: Which Act was formulated in the year he year 1986?
question_latex: Which Act was formulated in the year he year $1986$?
solution: The Environment (Protection) Act was enacted in 1986 following the Bhopal gas tragedy to provide a framework for environmental protection.

question: -1°C to 13°C annual variations in the intensity and duration of temperature and 50 and 250 cm annual variation in precipitation, account for the formation of a major biome as
question_latex: $-1^{\circ}C$ to $13^{\circ}C$ annual variations in the intensity and duration of temperature and $50$ and $250$ cm annual variation in precipitation, account for the formation of a major biome as
solution: Coniferous forests (taiga) are characterized by these specific temperature ranges and precipitation patterns, dominated by evergreen needle-leaved trees.

question: Which one of the following helps to neutralize and assimilate heavy metals fron waste water in the integrated waste water treatment process ?
question_latex: Which one of the following helps to neutralize and assimilate heavy metals fron waste water in the integrated waste water treatment process ?
options: A. Nitrifying bacteria in the fields
B. Methanogenic bacteria from waste water
C. Algae, fungi and bacteria from marsh land
D. Fishes, birds and animals from marsh land
answer: C. Algae, fungi and bacteria from marsh land
solution: In integrated waste water management, marshland ecosystems containing algae, fungi, and bacteria naturally neutralize and absorb heavy metals.

question: Which one of the following is NOT caused by global warming?* [MHT-CET 2022]
question_latex: Which one of the following is NOT caused by global warming?* [MHT-CET 2022]
solution: Global warming disrupts weather patterns and ecosystems, generally leading to decreased crop yields rather than increases.

question: Discolouration and physical deterioration of buildings and sculptures is due to
question_latex: Discolouration and physical deterioration of buildings and sculptures is due to
solution: $SO_{2}$ is the main cause of acid rain, which results in the chemical weathering and deterioration of stone and marble structures.

question: Which of the following is NOT ex-situ type of conservation of biodiversity?[MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which of the following is NOT ex-situ type of conservation of biodiversity?[MHT-CET 2024]
solution: In-situ conservation involves protecting species in their natural habitat; National Parks and Sanctuaries are examples of this approach.

question: Simlipal is
question_latex: Simlipal is
solution: Simlipal in Odisha is a prominent Biosphere Reserve in India, also functioning as a national park and tiger reserve.

question: In the treatment of waste water discharge, which treatment stage involves biological treatment? [MHT CET 2009]
question_latex: In the treatment of waste water discharge, which treatment stage involves biological treatment? [MHT CET 2009]
solution: Secondary treatment involves aeration tanks where aerobic bacteria decompose the organic matter present in the sewage.

question: One green house gas contributes 14% to total global warming and another contributes 6%. There are respectively identified as
question_latex: One green house gas contributes $14\%$ to total global warming and another contributes $6\%$. There are respectively identified as
solution: According to typical global warming contribution charts: $CO_{2}$ is $60\%$, methane is $20\%$, CFCs are $14\%$, and $N_{2}O$ is $6\%$.

question: Which one of the following is NOT the in-situ conservation of biodiversity? [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: Which one of the following is NOT the in-situ conservation of biodiversity? [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: Zoological parks are ex-situ conservation because animals are kept outside their natural habitats.

question: Given below are the two statements Statement I: Earth's surface re-emits the heat in the form of infrared radiations.
question_latex: Given below are the two statements Statement I: Earth's surface re-emits the heat in the form of infrared radiations.
options: A. Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.
B. Statement I is incorrect but statement II is correct.
C. Statement I is correct but statement II is incorrect.
D. Both statement I and statement II are correct.
answer: D. Both statement I and statement II are correct.
solution: Global warming involves the Earth surface re-emitting infrared radiation, which is then trapped by gases like $CO_{2}$ and $CH_{4}$.

question: Largest tiger population is found in
question_latex: Largest tiger population is found in
solution: The Sunderban National Park, a vast mangrove forest, hosts one of the largest and most unique populations of Bengal tigers.

question: Given below are two statements. Statement I: Absorption of UV radiations is directly proportional to the thickness of ozone.
question_latex: Given below are two statements. Statement I: Absorption of UV radiations is directly proportional to the thickness of ozone.
options: A. Both statement I and statement II are correct.
B. Statement I is incorrect but statement II is correct.
C. Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.
D. Statement I is correct but statement II is incorrect.
answer: D. Statement I is correct but statement II is incorrect.
solution: Statement I is true; Statement II is false because ozone is generated by shorter wavelength UV radiations, not infrared.

question: Photochemical smog pollution does not contain
question_latex: Photochemical smog pollution does not contain
solution: Photochemical smog is composed of secondary pollutants like $O_{3}$, $NO_{x}$, and PAN (Peroxyacetyl nitrate). It does not typically contain $CO_{2}$.

question: Checking of re-radiating heat by atmospheric dust O3, CO2 and water vapours is
question_latex: Checking of re-radiating heat by atmospheric dust $O_{3}$, $CO_{2}$ and water vapours is
solution: The phenomenon of atmospheric gases and particles trapping heat reflected from Earth is the greenhouse effect.

question: The extremely high sound level of decibels or more generated during the take off of a jet plane may cause damage to ear drum. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: The extremely high sound level of decibels or more generated during the take off of a jet plane may cause damage to ear drum. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Exposure to noise levels of $150$ decibels or more, such as those from a jet take-off, can cause immediate and permanent damage to hearing.

question: Which of these is an in situ method of conservation?
question_latex: Which of these is an in situ method of conservation?
solution: In-situ conservation refers to protecting the species within their natural ecosystem; National Parks are the primary legal mechanism for this.

question: Number of wild life is continuously decreasing. What is the main reason of this?
question_latex: Number of wild life is continuously decreasing. What is the main reason of this?
solution: While hunting and predation occur, the overarching cause of global wildlife decline is the widespread destruction and fragmentation of natural habitats.

question: Limit of BOD prescribed by Central Pollution Control Board for the discharge of industrial and municipal waste water into natural surface water, is
question_latex: Limit of BOD prescribed by Central Pollution Control Board for the discharge of industrial and municipal waste water into natural surface water, is
solution: The CPCB mandates a BOD limit of less than $10$ ppm for treated waste water being discharged into natural surface water bodies.

question: One of the most polluted river in Maharashtra is [MHT-CET 2016]
question_latex: One of the most polluted river in Maharashtra is [MHT-CET 2016]
solution: The Panchaganga river in Kolhapur district is one of the most polluted rivers in Maharashtra due to industrial and urban discharge.

question: Match the following with respect to different categories of red list. Choose the correct option.
question_latex: Match the following with respect to different categories of red list. Choose the correct option.
solution: Matching Red List: (a) Extinct - (iii) last individual died; (b) Extinct in wild - (i) only in captivity; (c) Endangered - (ii) population decline of 50-70%.

question: Which one of the following chemical compounds of medicinal use is secreted by Rauwolfia vomitoria?[2022]
question_latex: Which one of the following chemical compounds of medicinal use is secreted by Rauwolfia vomitoria?[2022]
solution: Reserpine is an alkaloid extracted from the roots of $Rauwolfia$ $vomitoria$, used for treating hypertension and certain mental disorders.

question: Habitat loss and fragmentation, over exploitation, alien species invasion and co-extinction are causes for
question_latex: Habitat loss and fragmentation, over exploitation, alien species invasion and co-extinction are causes for
solution: These four factors are known as the 'Evil Quartet' and are the primary drivers of global biodiversity loss.

question: In 1984, the Bhopal gas tragedy took place because methyl isocyanate
question_latex: In $1984$, the Bhopal gas tragedy took place because methyl isocyanate
solution: The disaster occurred when water entered a tank containing $40$ cubic meters of MIC, triggering a massive exothermic reaction and gas leak.

question: Which one of the following is an example of in situ conservation of biodiversity?
question_latex: Which one of the following is an example of in situ conservation of biodiversity?
solution: In-situ conservation is the protection of an entire ecosystem so that the species within it are protected in their natural habitat.

question: Which one of the following occurs due to changes in the environment and genetic variations of the species?[MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which one of the following occurs due to changes in the environment and genetic variations of the species?[MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Geographical isolation splits a population through physical barriers, which over time leads to genetic divergence and potentially new species.

question: A sewage treatment process, in which a portion of the decomposer bacteria present in the waste is recycled into the beginning of the process, is called
question_latex: A sewage treatment process, in which a portion of the decomposer bacteria present in the waste is recycled into the beginning of the process, is called
solution: The activated sludge process involves aeration followed by sedimentation, where some of the settled sludge is returned to the aeration tank to maintain high microbial activity.

question: Sanjay Gandhi Biological Park is situated in
question_latex: Sanjay Gandhi Biological Park is situated in
solution: Sanjay Gandhi Biological Park, also known as the Patna Zoo, is located in the capital of Bihar.

question: Minamata disease is caused due to presence of.. in water.
question_latex: Minamata disease is caused due to presence of.. in water.
solution: Consumption of methylmercury-contaminated seafood from Minamata Bay led to severe neurological symptoms and deaths.

question: The tiger census in our national parks is often based on [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: The tiger census in our national parks is often based on [MHT-CET 2023]
options: B. The actual count of individuals
C. The number on the collar around their neck
solution: While camera traps are now common, traditional tiger counting relies heavily on pugmark identification and DNA analysis of faecal pellets.

question: Siberian cranes are regular visitors of
question_latex: Siberian cranes are regular visitors of
options: D. Jim Corbett national park, Uttarakhand
solution: The Keoladeo National Park (Bharatpur) is a famous wintering ground for the rare Siberian crane.

question: The Minamata disease among fishermen in Japan is due to biomagnification of in the food chain.
question_latex: The Minamata disease among fishermen in Japan is due to biomagnification of in the food chain.
solution: Mercury released by industries was converted to organic methylmercury, which then bioaccumulated and biomagnified up the food chain to humans.

question: According to Kyoto protocol, the major nations abide to reduce concentration of green house gases by
question_latex: According to Kyoto protocol, the major nations abide to reduce concentration of green house gases by
solution: The first commitment period of the Kyoto Protocol aimed to reduce emissions by an average of $5\%$ against 1990 levels by 2012.

question: Ozone saves the biosphere by absorbing the high energy radiation called
question_latex: Ozone saves the biosphere by absorbing the high energy radiation called
solution: Ozone ($O_{3}$) in the stratosphere acts as a shield, absorbing $97-99\%$ of the sun's high-frequency ultraviolet light.

question: The term biomagnification refers to the
question_latex: The term biomagnification refers to the
options: A. Growth of organisms due to food consumption
C. Blowing up of environmental issues by man
D. Increasing in the concentration of non-degradable pollutants as they pass through food chain
answer: D. Increasing in the concentration of non-degradable pollutants as they pass through food chain
solution: Biomagnification is the cumulative increase in the concentration of persistent toxicants (like DDT or mercury) at successive trophic levels.

question: Terracing is done in
question_latex: Terracing is done in
solution: Terrace farming is an effective soil conservation technique used in hilly or mountainous regions to reduce the speed of runoff and soil erosion.

question: Mark the INCORRECT statement.[MHT-CET 2019]
question_latex: Mark the INCORRECT statement.[MHT-CET 2019]
options: A. Compressed natural gas (CNG) causes comparatively less air pollution than petrol
B. Electro static precipitators can be effectively used to separate gaseous pollutants.
C. The flame speed of methanol is higher than that of gasoline
D. Two stroke engines causes more air pollution than four stroke engines
answer: B. Electro static precipitators can be effectively used to separate gaseous pollutants.
solution: ESPs are designed specifically to remove particulate matter ($99\%$ efficiency) from smoke stacks, not gaseous pollutants.

question: Asiatic wild ass is an example of[MHT-CET 2016]
question_latex: Asiatic wild ass is an example of[MHT-CET 2016]
solution: The Asiatic wild ass (Khur) is found in the Little Rann of Kutch and is classified as an endangered species in India.

question: Methods to control air pollution include the following EXCEPT,* [MHT-CET 2017]
question_latex: Methods to control air pollution include the following EXCEPT,* [MHT-CET 2017]
solution: Electrodialysis is a membrane process used for water desalination and ion removal, not for air pollution control.

question: Reforestation is the [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Reforestation is the [MHT-CET 2023]
options: A. Process of restoring a forest that once existed but was destroyed
B. Plantation of more trees on barren land
C. Cutting and burning of trees for getting ash by the farmers
D. Conversion of forest area into an agricultural land
answer: A. Process of restoring a forest that once existed but was destroyed
solution: Reforestation is the intentional replanting of forests that have been depleted through deforestation or natural causes.

question: A sewage treatment process in which a part of decomposer bacteria present in the waste is recycled into the starting of the process is called
question_latex: A sewage treatment process in which a part of decomposer bacteria present in the waste is recycled into the starting of the process is called
solution: The aeration tank promotes the growth of aerobic bacteria (flocs), which are then settled and partially recycled as 'activated' sludge to seed the incoming sewage.

question: Maximum green house gases are released by [MHT CET 2007]
question_latex: Maximum green house gases are released by [MHT CET 2007]
solution: Historically, industrialized nations like the USA have been the largest contributors to cumulative greenhouse gas emissions.

question: Arrange the following options in ascending order of their BOD value.
question_latex: Arrange the following options in ascending order of their BOD value.
solution: BOD (Biochemical Oxygen Demand) increases with pollution. Ascending order: Clean water (III) < Moderate waste (I) < Highly polluted sewage (II).

question: The highest value of BOD is observed in
question_latex: The highest value of BOD is observed in
solution: Sewage water contains massive amounts of organic waste, requiring huge amounts of oxygen for microbial decomposition, resulting in very high BOD.

question: Distribution of diversity on earth shows that biodiversity from higher latitude to lower latitude.
question_latex: Distribution of diversity on earth shows that biodiversity from higher latitude to lower latitude.
solution: The latitudinal gradient of biodiversity shows that species richness increases as one moves from the poles (higher latitude) toward the equator (lower latitude).

question: Match the following :[ MHT-CET 2015] (i). Mercury (ii). Lead (iii). Arsenic (iv). Cadmium
question_latex: Match the following :[ MHT-CET 2015] (i). Mercury (ii). Lead (iii). Arsenic (iv). Cadmium
solution: Matching: Mercury - Abdominal pain/Minamata (d); Lead - Blindness/Lower BP (e); Arsenic - Liver cirrhosis (b); Cadmium - Bone deformation (c).

question: Biochemical Oxygen Demand (BOD) is a measure of
question_latex: Biochemical Oxygen Demand (BOD) is a measure of
options: A. industrial wastes poured into water bodies
B. Extent to which water is polluted with organic compound
C. amount of carbon monoxide inseparably combined with haemoglobin
D. amount of oxygen needed by green plants during night
answer: B. Extent to which water is polluted with organic compound
solution: BOD reflects the amount of dissolved oxygen needed by aerobic microorganisms to break down the organic matter in a water sample.

question: Which one of the following is not observed in biodiversity hot spots?
question_latex: Which one of the following is not observed in biodiversity hot spots?
solution: Hotspots are crowded with high species density, meaning interspecific competition is actually very high, not low.

question: The largest endangered bird in India is
question_latex: The largest endangered bird in India is
solution: The Great Indian Bustard ($Choriotis$ $nigriceps$) is a heavy ground bird and one of the most critically endangered species in India.

question: Effect of pollution is on [MHT CET 2003]
question_latex: Effect of pollution is on [MHT CET 2003]
solution: Pollution disrupts the delicate equilibrium between living and non-living components, leading to ecosystem instability.

question: ESP is to arrest
question_latex: ESP is to arrest
solution: ESP (Electrostatic Precipitator) is widely used in industries to remove particulate matter pollutants from exhaust air.

question: SO2 and NO2 produce pollution by increasing
question_latex: $SO_{2}$ and $NO_{2}$ produce pollution by increasing
solution: $SO_{2}$ and $NO_{2}$ are acidic gases that react with moisture to form sulphuric and nitric acid, leading to acid rain.

question: Ranthambor national park is situated in
question_latex: Ranthambor national park is situated in
solution: Ranthambore National Park is situated in the Sawai Madhopur district of Rajasthan and is known for its tiger population.

question: One of the most important functions of botanical gardens is that [MHT CET 2008]
question_latex: One of the most important functions of botanical gardens is that [MHT CET 2008]
options: A. One can observe tropical plants there
B. They allow ex situ conservation of germplasm
C. They provide the natural habitat for wild life
D. They provide a beautiful area for recreation
answer: B. They allow ex situ conservation of germplasm
solution: Botanical gardens serve as centers for ex-situ conservation, where various plant species are maintained in an artificial habitat similar to their natural one to preserve genetic material (germplasm).

question: Which one of the following heavy metals in water is responsible to cause growth retardation and bone deformation in humans?
question_latex: Which one of the following heavy metals in water is responsible to cause growth retardation and bone deformation in humans?
solution: Cadmium ($Cd$) is responsible for causing Itai-itai disease, which leads to growth retardation and bone deformation due to softening of bones (osteomalacia).

question: Ozone depletion from the stratosphere has become reason for causing which of the following diseases? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Ozone depletion from the stratosphere has become reason for causing which of the following diseases? [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: The depletion of the stratospheric ozone layer allows harmful UV radiation to reach the Earth, significantly increasing the risk of skin cancer and cataracts.

question: After completing his civil engineering degree, Ramesh was appointed as trainee in the R and D city development office, he was to work on the project of laying water repellent roads in the city, which one of the following method will he decide to implement for sustainability?
question_latex: After completing his civil engineering degree, Ramesh was appointed as trainee in the R and D city development office, he was to work on the project of laying water repellent roads in the city, which one of the following method will he decide to implement for sustainability?
options: A. Mixing wax in the cement to be used.
B. Adding plastic powder in the cement to be used.
C. Mixing 'Polyblend' in bitumen to be used.
D. Adding cement in the mixture to be used.
answer: C. Mixing 'Polyblend' in bitumen to be used.
solution: Polyblend is a recycled plastic powder that, when mixed with bitumen, enhances its water-repellent properties and increases road durability.

question: Fluoride pollution mainly affects
question_latex: Fluoride pollution mainly affects
solution: Excessive intake of fluoride through water causes mottling of teeth and skeletal fluorosis, which affects bones and joints.

question: $SO_{2}$ pollution is indicated by
question_latex: $SO_{2}$ pollution is indicated by
solution: Lichens like $Usnea$ are extremely sensitive to sulphur dioxide ($SO_{2}$) and act as reliable bioindicators of air pollution.

question: A lake with nutrients is called
question_latex: A lake with nutrients is called
solution: A lake that is rich in nutrients, typically supporting a dense plant population, is called a eutrophic lake.

question: Match Column I with Column-II and select the correct option. (i) High levels of Sulphur dioxide (ii) Endosulfan (iii) Pollen (iv) Gaseous and particulate lead.
question_latex: Match Column I with Column-II and select the correct option. \\ \textbf{Column I}: (i) High levels of $SO_{2}$ (ii) Endosulfan (iii) Pollen (iv) Gaseous and particulate lead \\ \textbf{Column II}: (a) Natural pollutant (b) Agricultural practices (c) Automobile exhaust (d) Electric power plants
solution: $SO_{2}$ is released from power plants; Endosulfan is used in agriculture; Pollen is a natural pollutant; Lead is found in automobile exhaust.

question: Which one of the following is used to reduce industrial exhaust emissions to the atmosphere to control air pollution? [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: Which one of the following is used to reduce industrial exhaust emissions to the atmosphere to control air pollution? [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: Catalytic converters are used to treat industrial and automobile exhaust by converting harmful gases like $CO$ and $NO_{x}$ into less harmful ones.

question: Megadiversity countries of the globe are [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Megadiversity countries of the globe are [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: There are 12 (or 17 in modern updates) megadiversity countries globally. The question option C refers to the traditional classification of 12.

question: Which of the following is not shortwave radiation?
question_latex: Which of the following is not shortwave radiation?
solution: Radio waves have a long wavelength ($10^{3}$ m), while X-rays, UV rays, and Cosmic rays are short-wave radiations.

question: Manas sanctuary is located at
question_latex: Manas sanctuary is located at
solution: Manas Wildlife Sanctuary is located in Assam (Asom) and is a project for the protection of tigers and rhinoceros.

question: Which one of the following is NOT caused by global warming? [MHT-CET 2018]
question_latex: Which one of the following is NOT caused by global warming? [MHT-CET 2018]
solution: Global warming disrupts the climate, usually resulting in a decrease in crop production rather than an increase.

question: Which of the following is NOT a source of air pollutant ?
question_latex: Which of the following is NOT a source of air pollutant ?
options: B. Use of CNG as fuel
answer: B. Use of CNG as fuel
solution: CNG is a non-polluting fuel compared to gasoline and diesel, and its use is a strategy to reduce air pollution.

question: The species listed in Red Data Book are
question_latex: The species listed in Red Data Book are
solution: The Red Data Book, maintained by IUCN, lists species that are threatened, including rare, vulnerable, and endangered categories.

question: One of the ex situ conservation method for endangered species is
question_latex: One of the ex situ conservation method for endangered species is
solution: Cryopreservation is an ex-situ technique involving the storage of biological materials at extremely low temperatures.

question: Global agreement in specific control strategies to reduce the release of ozone depleting substances, was adopted by
question_latex: Global agreement in specific control strategies to reduce the release of ozone depleting substances, was adopted by
solution: The Montreal Protocol (1987) focused on reducing the release of ozone-depleting substances like CFCs.

question: Common indicator organism of water pollution is
question_latex: Common indicator organism of water pollution is
solution: The presence of $E. coli$ in water indicates faecal contamination and is a primary indicator of water pollution.

question: Ozone depletion in stratosphere shall result in
question_latex: Ozone depletion in stratosphere shall result in
options: D. Increased incidence of skin cancer
answer: D. Increased incidence of skin cancer
solution: Ozone depletion allows UV radiation to reach Earth, leading to higher rates of skin cancer and cataracts.

question: Particulate pollution from industries and power generation plants can be controlled by [MHT-CET 2019]
question_latex: Particulate pollution from industries and power generation plants can be controlled by [MHT-CET 2019]
solution: Electrostatic precipitators are used to remove particulate pollutants from industrial exhaust gases.

question: Fly ash is a/an
question_latex: Fly ash is a/an
options: C. New name of orchid plant
D. Causal organism of various disease
solution: Fly ash is a light airborne particulate matter produced primarily by coal-based thermal power plants.

question: Which element is caused of itai-itai disease?
question_latex: Which element is caused of itai-itai disease?
solution: Cadmium ($Cd$) poisoning leads to Itai-itai disease, characterized by severe bone pain and joint deformation.

question: The oxygen concentration at the floor of the deep ponds and lakes is very low because of the [MHT CET 2007]
question_latex: The oxygen concentration at the floor of the deep ponds and lakes is very low because of the [MHT CET 2007]
options: D. Large number of annual inhabitants
solution: The floor of deep lakes receives less sunlight, limiting photosynthesis and resulting in lower oxygen concentrations.

question: CFCs are responsible for
question_latex: CFCs are responsible for
solution: Chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) are primary ozone-depleting substances that release chlorine free radicals upon exposure to UV light.

question: Green house effect is due to the increased concentration of
question_latex: Green house effect is due to the increased concentration of
solution: The accumulation of greenhouse gases, primarily $CO_{2}$, prevents heat from being re-radiated, warming the atmosphere.

question: Identify the sacred groves found in India from the following list. (i) Khasi and Jaintia (ii) Western ghat (iii) Aravalli Hills (iv) Chanda and Sarguja (v) Ladakh [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Identify the sacred groves found in India from the following list. (i) Khasi and Jaintia (ii) Western ghat (iii) Aravalli Hills (iv) Chanda and Sarguja (v) Ladakh [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Sacred groves are in-situ conservation areas. Khasi, Western Ghats, Aravalli, and Chanda/Sarguja are all recognized sacred groves in India.

question: In 1984, Bhopal gas tragedy was caused due to leakage of [MHT-CET 2014]
question_latex: In 1984, Bhopal gas tragedy was caused due to leakage of [MHT-CET 2014]
solution: The disaster was caused by the leakage of methyl isocyanate ($MIC$) from the Union Carbide plant.

question: Total number of all species of organisms in a given region is known as the region's
question_latex: Total number of all species of organisms in a given region is known as the region's
solution: The biota of a region comprises the sum total of its flora (plants) and fauna (animals).

question: Which one of the following is also called 'Terror of Bengal'? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which one of the following is also called 'Terror of Bengal'? [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Water hyacinth ($Eichhornia$) is an invasive alien species that clogs water bodies, earning the name 'Terror of Bengal'.

question: Ozone ($O_{3}$) depletion is due to
question_latex: Ozone ($O_{3}$) depletion is due to
solution: CFCs are the primary chemicals responsible for stratospheric ozone depletion.

question: Carbon dioxide is called green house gas because it is
question_latex: Carbon dioxide is called green house gas because it is
options: A. Used in green house to increase plant growth
B. Transparent to heat but traps sunlight
C. Transparent to sunlight but traps heat
D. Transparent to both sunlight and heat
answer: C. Transparent to sunlight but traps heat
solution: $CO_{2}$ is transparent to incoming short-wave solar radiation but absorbs long-wave infrared (heat) radiation reflected from Earth.

question: Which one of the following is a natural cause of extinction of flora and fauna?
question_latex: Which one of the following is a natural cause of extinction of flora and fauna?
solution: Wild fires are a natural phenomenon that can cause significant habitat destruction and species extinction.

question: The animal, extincted from India is
question_latex: The animal, extincted from India is
solution: The Asiatic cheetah was declared extinct in India in 1952 due to hunting and habitat loss.

question: It is used in refrigerator and air conditioners and it is a source of Cl
question_latex: It is used in refrigerator and air conditioners and it is a source of Cl
solution: Freon (a type of CFC) is widely used in refrigeration systems and releases chlorine atoms that deplete ozone.

question: All are sources of particulate pollutants EXCEPT [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: All are sources of particulate pollutants EXCEPT [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Nitrogen oxides are gaseous pollutants, whereas smoke, dust, and particulate pesticides are particulate pollutants.

question: $SO_{2}$ pollution affects
question_latex: $SO_{2}$ pollution affects
solution: Intense $SO_{2}$ pollution disrupts cell membrane integrity and degrades chlorophyll in plants.

question: Which one of the following is the correct percentage of the two green house gases that contribute to the total global warming?
question_latex: Which one of the following is the correct percentage of the two green house gases that contribute to the total global warming?
solution: Global warming contributions: $CO_{2}$ (60%), $CH_{4}$ (20%), CFCs (14%), and $N_{2}O$ (6%).

question: Which of the following is exhaustible but limited source of energy?
question_latex: Which of the following is exhaustible but limited source of energy?
solution: Fossil fuels are non-renewable resources that have a finite supply and are eventually exhausted.

question: Out of total incident solar radiation, which type of radiations are absorbed by plants and photo synthetic bacteria? [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Out of total incident solar radiation, which type of radiations are absorbed by plants and photo synthetic bacteria? [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Plants and photosynthetic bacteria absorb PAR, which is the spectral range from 400 to 700 nm.

question: Which one of the following is a major pollutant of automobile gases?
question_latex: Which one of the following is a major pollutant of automobile gases?
solution: $CO$ is a primary pollutant in automobile exhaust, combining with hemoglobin 200 times faster than oxygen.

question: Which of the following is non-biodegradable?
question_latex: Which of the following is non-biodegradable?
solution: DDT is a persistent organochlorine that does not degrade naturally and accumulates in biological tissues.

question: A taxon, which is facing an extremely high risk of extinction in the wild in immediate future is known as
question_latex: A taxon, which is facing an extremely high risk of extinction in the wild in immediate future is known as
solution: Critically endangered species are at the highest risk level before being declared extinct in the wild.

question: Which of the following strategies is not a correct approach to reduce global warming?
question_latex: Which of the following strategies is not a correct approach to reduce global warming?
options: C. Minimising use of nitrogen fertilizers
D. Increasing use of air conditioners
answer: D. Increasing use of air conditioners
solution: Increasing the use of AC units and refrigeration leads to more CFC/HFC release, exacerbating global warming.

question: Biodiversity Act of India was passed by the Parliament in the year
question_latex: Biodiversity Act of India was passed by the Parliament in the year
solution: The Biological Diversity Act was enacted by the Parliament of India in 2002.

question: The total number of biodiversity hot spots in the world are
question_latex: The total number of biodiversity hot spots in the world are
solution: The number of biodiversity hotspots has increased over time; 34 is the standard recognized figure in many biology curricula.

question: Acid rain is mainly caused due to increase in the levels of the gas(es)
question_latex: Acid rain is mainly caused due to increase in the levels of the gas(es)
solution: Acid rain results from atmospheric pollutants like $SO_{2}$ and $NO_{2}$ reacting with water vapor to form sulfuric and nitric acids.

question: Rivet popper Hypothesis was given by [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Rivet popper Hypothesis was given by [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Paul Ehrlich used the analogy of rivets in an airplane to explain the importance of every species in an ecosystem.

question: Industrial effluents rich in phosphorus causes overgrowth of algae. This is known as [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Industrial effluents rich in phosphorus causes overgrowth of algae. This is known as [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Eutrophication is the nutrient enrichment of water bodies, often leading to algal blooms and oxygen depletion.

question: Which one of the following is NOT an example of ex-situ conservation of endangered species? [MHT-CET 2017]
question_latex: Which one of the following is NOT an example of ex-situ conservation of endangered species? [MHT-CET 2017]
solution: National parks are in-situ conservation sites, as species are protected within their natural environment.

question: Species richness is at lower latitudes and there is steady towards the poles. [2022]
question_latex: Species richness is at lower latitudes and there is steady towards the poles. [2022]
solution: The latitudinal gradient shows that biodiversity is highest at the equator (low latitude) and decreases toward the poles.

question: Which of the following are exotic herbs that affect the growth of native species (I) Rauwolfia (II) Parthenium (III) Gnetum (IV) Lantana camara
question_latex: Which of the following are exotic herbs that affect the growth of native species (I) $Rauwolfia$ (II) $Parthenium$ (III) $Gnetum$ (IV) $Lantana$ $camara$
solution: Parthenium (Carrot grass) and Lantana are invasive exotic species in India that outcompete native flora.

question: Paul Ehrlich suggested Rivet Popper Hypothesis in which he compared the ecosystem and species to and respectively. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Paul Ehrlich suggested Rivet Popper Hypothesis in which he compared the ecosystem and species to and respectively. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Ehrlich's hypothesis compares the ecosystem to an airplane and the constituent species to the rivets holding it together.

question: Which one of the following is INCORRECT with respect to Verhulst-Pearl Logistic Growth. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which one of the following is INCORRECT with respect to Verhulst-Pearl Logistic Growth. [MHT-CET 2024]
options: A. it shows geometric growth in population
C. It is a sigmoid curve
D. It occurs when resources are limited
answer: A. it shows geometric growth in population
solution: Logistic growth is sigmoid and occurs when resources are limited. Geometric (exponential) growth occurs only under unlimited resource conditions.

question: The thickness of ozone in a column of air from the ground to the top of the atmosphere is measured in terms of
question_latex: The thickness of ozone in a column of air from the ground to the top of the atmosphere is measured in terms of
solution: The concentration/thickness of the ozone layer is measured in Dobson Units ($DU$).

question: Conservation in natural habitat is
question_latex: Conservation in natural habitat is
solution: In-situ conservation is the maintenance of biodiversity in its natural habitat (e.g., National Parks).

question: Which one of the following is NOT the in-situ conservation of biodiversity? [MHT-CET 2018]
question_latex: Which one of the following is NOT the in-situ conservation of biodiversity? [MHT-CET 2018]
solution: Zoological parks are ex-situ conservation because animals are kept outside their natural ecosystems.

question: World Summit on Sustainable Development (2002) was held in
question_latex: World Summit on Sustainable Development (2002) was held in
solution: The 2002 Earth Summit (Rio+10) took place in Johannesburg, South Africa.

question: The cause of decline in the population of reptiles and birds is
question_latex: The cause of decline in the population of reptiles and birds is
solution: DDT causes eggshell thinning in birds and reptiles, leading to population crashes through biomagnification.

question: The behavioural response to cope with the hot weather in their environment is very well exhibited by .. [2022]
question_latex: The behavioural response to cope with the hot weather in their environment is very well exhibited by .. [2022]
solution: Desert lizards manage their body temperature through behavioral adaptations like basking in the sun or moving to shade.

question: It has been observed that species richness is very low in north and south poles. Which one of the following could be a possible reason for it? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: It has been observed that species richness is very low in north and south poles. Which one of the following could be a possible reason for it? [MHT-CET 2024]
options: A. Periodic glaciations like drastic climate changes.
B. Lesser drastic climatic changes throughout the year.
C. Availability of plenty of sunlight.
D. Lesser migrations have reduced gene flow and favored speciation.
answer: A. Periodic glaciations like drastic climate changes.
solution: Temperatue regions and poles have experienced periodic glaciations, which prevents the stable accumulation of species richness seen in the tropics.

question: Approval of Utilization of any biological resources for commercial or industrial purpose at local level is taken from [2022]
question_latex: Approval of Utilization of any biological resources for commercial or industrial purpose at local level is taken from [2022]
solution: Local-level management and approval for resource utilization fall under Biodiversity Management Committees ($BMCs$).

question: Select the correct option with respect to in situ type of conservation of biodiversity from the following. I) Botanical garden II) National park III) Seed bank IV) Zoological park V) Sacred groves VI) Wildlife sanctuaries VII) Biosphere reserve [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Select the correct option with respect to in situ type of conservation of biodiversity from the following. I) Botanical garden II) National park III) Seed bank IV) Zoological park V) Sacred groves VI) Wildlife sanctuaries VII) Biosphere reserve [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: In-situ conservation includes National Parks (II), Sacred Groves (V), Wildlife Sanctuaries (VI), and Biosphere Reserves (VII).

question: Supreme Court of India has banned loudspeakers at public gatherings after [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Supreme Court of India has banned loudspeakers at public gatherings after [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: To control noise pollution, the Supreme Court mandated a ban on loud speakers after 10 pm in public areas.

question: Match the scientist in column I with their contribution in column II. (a) Alexander Van Humboldt (b) Robert May (c) David Tillman (d) Paul Ehrlich [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Match the scientist in column I with their contribution in column II. \\ (a) Alexander Van Humboldt --- (iii) Species Area Relationship \\ (b) Robert May --- (i) Estimated 7 million species \\ (c) David Tillman --- (iv) Productivity stability hypothesis \\ (d) Paul Ehrlich --- (ii) Rivet popper hypothesis
solution: Humboldt gave species-area relationship; May estimated global species; Tillman focused on stability; Ehrlich gave rivet-popper.

question: Biosphere reserves differ from national parks and wild life sanctuaries because in the former
question_latex: Biosphere reserves differ from national parks and wild life sanctuaries because in the former
options: A. Human beings are not allowed to enter
B. People are an integral part of the system
C. Plants are paid greater attention than the animals
D. Living organisms are brought from all over the world and preserved
answer: B. People are an integral part of the system
solution: Biosphere reserves explicitly include human communities as part of the ecosystem management (Buffer and Transition zones).

question: Psilotum nudum is a/an species.
question_latex: Psilotum nudum is a/an species.
solution: Psilotum nudum (whisk fern) is an endangered pteridophyte endemic to specific regions in India like Sheshachalam hills.

question: Tiger is not resident in which one of the following national park?
question_latex: Tiger is not resident in which one of the following national park?
solution: Gir National Park is primarily a sanctuary for the Asiatic Lion ($Panthera$ $leo$ $persica$).

question: During the tertiary treatment of sewage, chlorination is done to. [2022]
question_latex: During the tertiary treatment of sewage, chlorination is done to. [2022]
solution: Tertiary treatment involves chemical disinfection, usually chlorination, to eliminate remaining pathogenic microbes.

question: Which of the following is not used for disinfection of drinking water?
question_latex: Which of the following is not used for disinfection of drinking water?
solution: Phenyl is a surface disinfectant and is toxic for ingestion; ozone and chlorine are used for drinking water purification.

question: Chlorofluorocarbon is responsible for [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Chlorofluorocarbon is responsible for [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: CFCs migrate to the stratosphere and release chlorine, which catalytically destroys ozone molecules.

question: Kyoto protocol has specified the commitments of different countries
question_latex: Kyoto protocol has specified the commitments of different countries
options: C. To prepare a world climate programme
solution: The Kyoto Protocol (1997) is an international treaty aimed at reducing greenhouse gas emissions to mitigate global climate change.

question: Identify the correct matched pair. [MHT CET 2008]
question_latex: Identify the correct matched pair. [MHT CET 2008]
options: D. Rann of Kutch- Wild ass
answer: D. Rann of Kutch- Wild ass

question: Nitrogen oxides produced from automobiles lead to
question_latex: Nitrogen oxides produced from automobiles lead to
solution: Nitrogen oxides ($NO_{x}$) are precursors to photochemical smog when they react with sunlight and hydrocarbons.

question: Chipko movement is related to
question_latex: Chipko movement is related to
solution: Sunder Lal Bahuguna was a key leader of the Chipko movement for forest protection in the Himalayas.

question: Following are the advantages of using CNG as a fuel EXCEPT [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Following are the advantages of using CNG as a fuel EXCEPT [MHT-CET 2023]
options: B. It is adulteration proof fuel
C. It will never get exhausted
answer: C. It will never get exhausted
solution: CNG is a fossil fuel (natural gas) and is a non-renewable, finite resource that will eventually be exhausted.

question_latex: Availability of intense sunlight and warmer temperature in tropics lead to species richness. [2022]
options: B. Statement I correct II incorrect
D. Statement I incorrect II correct
solution: Tropical regions favor high productivity and speciation due to consistent energy input and stable climate.

question: Ban on use, sale, and storage of plastic was implemented in Maharashtra in [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Ban on use, sale, and storage of plastic was implemented in Maharashtra in [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: The Maharashtra plastic ban was officially implemented in June 2018 to reduce non-biodegradable waste.

question: Polyblend a fine powder of recycled modified plastic was used
question_latex: Polyblend a fine powder of recycled modified plastic was used
solution: Polyblend is mixed with bitumen to create more durable, water-resistant roads.

question: Particulate pollutants of size 2.5 nm damage lungs by going deep into it. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Particulate pollutants of size $2.5$ nm damage lungs by going deep into it. [MHT-CET 2024]

solution: Fine particulate matter (PM 2.5) can penetrate deep into the lungs and enter the bloodstream, causing respiratory and cardiovascular issues.

question: Green house effect with respect to global climate refers to
question_latex: Green house effect with respect to global climate refers to
solution: The greenhouse effect is the rise in temperature on Earth due to the trapping of heat by atmospheric gases.

question: Kyoto protocol is related with
question_latex: Kyoto protocol is related with
solution: The Kyoto Protocol specifically targets the reduction of greenhouse gases to control global warming.

question: Match Column - I (Mango varieties, Biosphere, Parks, Sanctuaries) with their number in India. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Match Column - I with their number found in India. \\ (a) Mango varieties --- (iii) 1000 \\ (b) Biosphere reserves --- (i) 14 \\ (c) National parks --- (iv) 90 \\ (d) Wildlife sanctuaries --- (ii) 448
solution: India has 1000+ mango varieties, 14 biosphere reserves (traditionally), 90 national parks, and 448 wildlife sanctuaries according to standard texts.

question: With reference to the given Pie-chart of plants, identify the correct statement.
question_latex: With reference to the given Pie-chart of plants, identify the correct statement.
options: A. Diversity of monocots is equal to dicots.
B. Flowering plants are the dominant group showing highest diversity.
C. Diversity of conifers is equal to sum of ferns and mosses.
D. Diversity of dicot is equal to sum of ferns and mosses.
answer: B. Flowering plants are the dominant group showing highest diversity.
solution: In the global plant diversity chart, angiosperms (dicots and monocots) represent the vast majority of species.

question: Which insecticide is more hazardous to human health?
question_latex: Which insecticide is more hazardous to human health?
solution: DDT is a persistent, non-biodegradable organochlorine that causes severe ecological damage and biomagnification.

question: Green-house effect refers to
question_latex: Green-house effect refers to
solution: The greenhouse effect results in the warming of the Earth's surface and lower atmosphere.

question: Foul smell in the water bodies of tanks, ponds,etc, is due to
question_latex: Foul smell in the water bodies of tanks, ponds,etc, is due to
solution: Organic pollution leads to oxygen depletion, causing anaerobic decomposition which releases foul-smelling gases like $H_{2}S$.

question: Heating up of earth's atmosphere occurs due to from earth's surface. [MHT-CET 2019]
question_latex: Heating up of earth's atmosphere occurs due to from earth's surface. [MHT-CET 2019]
solution: Greenhouse gases trap long-wave infrared radiation that is reflected/re-emitted from the Earth's surface.

question: The percentage of forest cover recommended by the national forest policy (1988) is
question_latex: The percentage of forest cover recommended by the national forest policy (1988) is
options: A. 33% for plains and 67% for hills
B. 37% for plains and 63% for hills
C. 20% for plains and 70% for hills
D. 23% for plains and 77% for hills
answer: A. 33% for plains and 67% for hills
solution: The 1988 policy set targets to ensure ecological balance through substantial forest cover in different terrains.

question: The term is used for category of species that possesses high risk of extinction with very few surviving members. [2022]
question_latex: The term is used for category of species that possesses high risk of extinction with very few surviving members. [2022]
solution: Critically endangered species are those facing an extremely high risk of extinction in the wild.

question: Action of UV rays on forms ozone layer.
question_latex: Action of UV rays on forms ozone layer.
solution: Ozone is formed in the stratosphere through the action of solar UV radiation on molecular oxygen ($O_{2}$).

question: Ozone hole results in
question_latex: Ozone hole results in
options: A. UV radiation reaches the earth
solution: Depletion of ozone allows more UV radiation to reach Earth, causing health issues like cataracts and skin cancer.

question: The water hyacinth (Eichhornia crassipes) is a native of [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: The water hyacinth (Eichhornia crassipes) is a native of [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: $Eichhornia$ is native to South America's Amazon basin and was introduced globally as an ornamental plant.

question: In India, hot spot area is found in
question_latex: In India, hot spot area is found in
solution: The Eastern Himalayas and Western Ghats are the two primary biodiversity hotspots located within India.

question: Recent reports of acid rains in big industrial cities are due to
question_latex: Recent reports of acid rains in big industrial cities are due to
solution: The combustion of fossil fuels in industries releases $SO_{2}$ and $NO_{x}$, which combine with rain to form acids.

question: Taj Mahal marble is affected by
question_latex: Taj Mahal marble is affected by
solution: Sulphur dioxide emitted from refineries reacts with moisture to form sulfuric acid, which corrodes the Taj Mahal's marble.

question: Rauwolfia vomitoria found in Himalayan ranges shows variation in potency and concentration of reserpine. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Rauwolfia vomitoria found in Himalayan ranges shows variation in potency and concentration of reserpine. [MHT-CET 2024]
options: A. Both statement I and II correct
B. Statement I incorrect II correct
C. Statement I correct II incorrect
D. Both statement I and II incorrect
answer: C. Statement I correct II incorrect
solution: Genetic diversity is shown by $Rauwolfia$ in the Himalayas; statement II regarding Rann of Kutch ecosystem diversity is generally incorrect in this specific context.

question: Nutrient enrichment of a lake will cause
question_latex: Nutrient enrichment of a lake will cause
solution: Eutrophication is the natural or cultural process of nutrient enrichment leading to organic load and oxygen depletion.

question: Which one of the following is non-renewable exhaustible natural resource?
question_latex: Which one of the following is non-renewable exhaustible natural resource?
solution: Wait, standard biology resources classify fossil fuels/minerals as non-renewable. The question's intended answer D (Aquatic animals) might be a typo in the source PDF; typically, renewable resources include wildlife/aquatic life. However, mineral deposits are the true non-renewable exhaustible resource.

question: The dolphin found in Chilka lake is
question_latex: The dolphin found in Chilka lake is
solution: Chilika Lake in Odisha is home to the only known population of Irrawaddy dolphins in India.
